<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/consumer-reports-releases-annual-auto-reliability-report?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
In Consumer Reports We Trust
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of a car with muscular arms coming out of the sides" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNzc1MTUzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ahead of the busy season for school parking lot donuts, Consumer Reports released the results of its closely watched automobile reliability survey. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The deets: </strong>Every year, the nonprofit magazine collects responses on its members' experiences with their cars. This year, it received reviews for over 420,000 vehicles. It then ranks 30 auto brands sold in the U.S. in terms of their "reliability," which factors in potential <a href="https://www.consumerreports.org/car-reliability-owner-satisfaction/consumer-reports-car-reliability-faq/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">problems</a> in 17 trouble areas. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What we learned this year...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Rule #1: If it ain't broke, don't turn it into the Batmobile </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Consumer Reports found that newly redesigned models gave owners <a href="https://www.consumerreports.org/car-reliability-owner-satisfaction/how-a-vehicle-redesign-can-drag-down-car-reliability/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more problems</a> than vehicles bought close to the end of their production runs. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">A common complaint: </strong></span><span>Automakers have added gears to transmissions to meet fuel economy rules, but sometimes driving with 10 speeds is a little intense. Many readers reported rough, jerky transmissions in redesigned models, CR's director of auto testing </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/95cb2141a82045e59fe8dde06fa695ce?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the AP</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In all, 45% of new or redesigned vehicles have predicted reliability that's below average.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Rule #2: Japanese cars are the most reliable </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lexus, Mazda, and Toyota were named the <a href="https://www.consumerreports.org/car-reliability-owner-satisfaction/who-makes-the-most-reliable-cars/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most reliable car brands</a> in that order (Lexus is Toyota's luxury brand). South Korea's Hyundai also had a strong showing; its Genesis, Hyundai, and Kia brands all made it into the top 10. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. and European automakers...get your shift together. GM's Cadillac brand came in <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-makes-some-improvements-in-consumer-reports-latest-reliability-ranks-11573753526?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dead last</a>, while Ford's F-150 pickup—despite being the top-selling vehicle in the U.S.—has below-average reliability. Meanwhile, CR members consider VW's and Acura's SUVs to be "problematic." </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Rule #3: Always close your auto stories on a high note </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After pulling it last year, Consumer Reports <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/14/consumer-reports-puts-tesla-back-on-recommended-list-as-reliability-improves.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">restored</a> Tesla's Model 3 and Model S "recommended" rating. Turns out, when your CEO doesn't have to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2018-07-12/how-tesla-s-model-3-became-elon-musk-s-version-of-hell?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sleep under a desk</a> at the factory to oversee production, you can make a more reliable car. As a brand, Tesla moved up four spots to #23. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
NEWS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/shareholders-approve-gatehouses-11b-gannett-acquisition?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Open the GateHouse and Seize the Day
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of newspaper presses running" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YfRc9QhF2lBMQ/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of newspaper presses running" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YfRc9QhF2lBMQ/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ladies and gentlereaders, meet the largest newspaper publisher in the U.S. Yesterday, shareholders <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/11/14/gannett-finalizes-deal-become-nations-largest-newspaper-publisher-setting-stage-million-cuts/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved</a> GateHouse parent New Media Investment Group's <span>~$1.1</span> billion acquisition of Gannett. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Run the numbers:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The combined company will publish </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/14/business/media/gannett-gatehouse-media-merger.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">260+ daily newspapers</a></span><span> and 300+ weeklies, including USA Today, The Detroit Free Press, and The Palm Beach Post. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Print circulation is estimated to top 8 million, while web traffic is </span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2019/11/14/gannett-new-media-investment-group-merger-vote-results/2578352001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expected</a></span><span> to average more than 145 million monthly unique visitors. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To stay out of the Newseum, Gannett (the new company's name) has said it will find up to $300 million in savings. That worries the U.S.' top newspaper union, which <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/11/08/gannett-merger-nears-completion-union-claims-deal-threatens-journalism/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warned</a> that "local papers will likely disappear, jobs will be slashed, and journalism will suffer" because of the deal.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The U.S. has lost almost 1,800 papers since 2004, per <a href="https://www.usnewsdeserts.com/reports/expanding-news-desert/loss-of-local-news/loss-newspapers-readers/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">UNC research</a>. And the majority of those remaining have a circulation of less than 15,000. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the companies expect the deal to close next Tuesday, Nov. 19.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/round-2-warren-vs-billionaires?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's Round 2 for Warren vs. the Billionaires
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, presidential candidate Sen. Elizabeth Warren released an <a href="https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.cnbc.com/amp/2019/11/13/elizabeth-warren-blasts-billionaires-in-campaign-ad-calling-for-wealth-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ad</a>, "Elizabeth Warren Stands Up to Billionaires." It alleges former Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein, investor Leon Cooperman, and VC Peter Thiel engaged in some shady dealings.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Blankfein </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/14/lloyd-blankfein-mocks-elizabeth-warren-maybe-tribalism-is-just-in-her-dna.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shot back</a></span><span> on Twitter, "Maybe tribalism is just in her DNA," an apparent reference to Warren's previous claims of Native American ancestry. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Warren's been bare-knuckle boxing with billionaires for weeks. An aggressive <a href="https://elizabethwarren.com/ultra-millionaire-tax/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wealth tax</a> is key to funding her ultra-expensive plans like Medicare for All. But many on Wall St. are balking at the proposed 6% hit on assets above $1 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Blankfein's co-stars also have thoughts: <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Thiel: </strong></span><span>"I'm most scared by Elizabeth Warren." </span><span><strong style="color:#000">Warren's response:</strong></span><span> "</span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/07/16/peter-thiel-vs-elizabeth-warren/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Good</a></span><span>."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Cooperman: "</strong></span><span>This is the f—ing American dream she is s—ting on." Cooperman got teary on CNBC thinking about it. </span><span><strong style="color:#000">Warren's response: </strong></span><span>Adding </span><span><a href="https://shop.elizabethwarren.com/products/billionaire-tears-mug?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a "billionaire tears" mug</a></span><span> to her merch offerings. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>a recent <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/14/business/warren-wealth-tax-economy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">analysis</a> from the <span>Penn Wharton Budget Model </span>estimated Warren's plan would depress economic growth about 0.2% over a decade. <span>But economists in Warren's corner say that doesn't account for the indirect jumpstart the economy would get from expanded social programs.</span></p>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>

</th>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/worlds-biggest-starbucks-opens-chicago?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Large Space to Wait Out a Downpour Opens in Chicago
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Starbucks Roastery " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODI2L3N0YXJidWNrc19yb2FzdGVyeS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Starbucks</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, the world’s largest Starbucks <a href="https://chicago.eater.com/2019/11/13/20961830/chicago-starbucks-reserve-roastery-photos-images-worlds-largest?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opens</a> in Chicago. The 35,000 square-feet of awkward networking space will join seven other Starbucks stores already located on the Magnificent Mile. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This one, of course, is different. It’s the company's sixth “Reserve Roastery,” </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/12/take-a-look-inside-starbucks-newest-reserve-roastery-in-chicago.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mega-locations</a></span><span> handcrafted to match each city’s vibe. Roasteries can serve over 8,000 visitors per day on average. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We know what you’re thinking: </strong><em>How many beans does one city need? </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ask the Roastery's architects, who were clearly ripping triple-shots during the design process. A 56-foot cask (or bean container) <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90427426/inside-the-new-largest-starbucks-on-the-planet?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">forms the spine</a>, supporting a hamster cage-esque system of tubes that uses air pressure to zoom beans throughout the store. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Across the five floors you'll find three coffee bars, a bakery, a roof terrace, and a cocktail bar (heck yeah they serve Malört).</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The other roasteries are located in NYC, Tokyo, Shanghai, Milan, and Seattle. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY ETORO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Copy the Pros. Take the Credit.
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve all heard of a top trader in the crypto market. While they trade in and out of Bitcoin and Ethereum, you sit there on the sidelines…missing out. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But…what if you could just copy them <em>automatically</em>? Skip out on all the intimidating research and <strong style="color:#000">make the same trades they do,</strong> in real time. Wouldn’t that be easy? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well that’s exactly how eToro’s <a href="https://www.etoro.com/en-us/?dl=30001923&utm_medium=Media&utm_source=81932&utm_content=0&utm_serial=&utm_campaign=&utm_term=&from_lp=whiteLP" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CopyTrader</a> works. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The favorite feature of eToro’s 11+ million users, <a href="https://www.etoro.com/en-us/?dl=30001923&utm_medium=Media&utm_source=81932&utm_content=0&utm_serial=&utm_campaign=&utm_term=&from_lp=whiteLP" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CopyTrader</a>, lets you automatically copy the trades of up to 100 top traders on their platform—so you don’t have to stay glued to a ticker screen. Just hit copy, and sit back.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, to make it even easier, eToro is letting you <strong style="color:#000">practice with a $100,000 virtual portfolio</strong>. Learn how to trade without risking a cent.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trade crypto the easy way. Just hit copy, with <a href="https://www.etoro.com/en-us/?dl=30001923&utm_medium=Media&utm_source=81932&utm_content=0&utm_serial=&utm_campaign=&utm_term=&from_lp=whiteLP" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CopyTrader</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Why Aren't Sports and Streams the Dream Team?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=378 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0CLVfBA3Viu2D2s8/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0CLVfBA3Viu2D2s8/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>It’s Day 4 of our teardown of the streaming industry to mark the launch of Disney+. If you missed them, here are </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>part 1</em></a>,<em> </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/4-minute-history-disney?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>part 2</em></a>, <em>and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/streaming-subscription-costs-dollarsheres?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">part 3</a>. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that you have hundreds of hours of <em>The Simpsons </em>at your fingertips, it's no sweat to cut the cord...right? Turns out, there's one thing traditional TV customers still cling to: live sports. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Networks like CBS, Fox, and ESPN have together paid billions for the exclusive rights to air U.S. professional sports games. But starting in 2021, bidding rights for the big leagues start to reopen. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">We hear Big Tech has a big wallet </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bezos, forget buying an NFL team...what about buying the streaming rights? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With expansive media platforms already spun up, tech companies could bring professional sports to a streaming-first model without starting from scratch. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They could layer on features like in-game polls to create personalized, interactive experiences. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some leagues and tournaments have tested live streams that allow viewers to </span><span><a href="https://frntofficesport.com/twitter-nba-tnt/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">follow</a></span><span> a single player or watch in </span><span><a href="https://www.ncaa.com/news/basketball-men/article/2019-04-08/how-watch-2019-ncaa-march-madness-games-virtual-reality?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtual reality</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The catch: </strong>Leagues have been hesitant to give exclusive live rights to tech companies, Quartz <a href="https://qz.com/1418594/the-future-of-how-we-watch-sports-is-in-limbo-until-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>. Hulu and YouTube TV have crashed during major sports broadcasts. And even Disney+ was stumbling on Tuesday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>If you want to learn more about the future of sports streaming, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/future-sports-live-streaming?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we’ve got you covered here</a>.</em></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

</div>

QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/brews-weekly-news-quiz-november-15?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Quiz+

</h1>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still missing our hot pink RAZR. Only flies out of EWR. The last remaining newsletter that drinks milk. It's the Brew's Weekly News Quiz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blank:</strong> According to LinkedIn's 2019 Veteran Opportunity Report, a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/10/vets-looking-work-tech-seems-like-promising-industry?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third of veterans</a> are _________, meaning their jobs don't take full advantage of their skills and capabilities.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. Is <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/kkr-formally-approaches-walgreens-buyout?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Walgreens's debt</a> <strong style="color:#000">greater or less than</strong> $15 billion? Private equity firm KKR wants to know. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. What is the nickname of Google's new <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/google-set-offer-checking-account?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banking initiative</a>?</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nightingale</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cache</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Needlefish</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Michael Guglé</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. <strong style="color:#000">True or false: </strong>Within 90 minutes, Alibaba's Singles Day sales <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/singles-day-stats-make-go-wow?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beat the total</a> from Singles Day 2016. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. Match the streaming service to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">its starting monthly price</a>:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Streaming service: </strong></span><span>Disney+, Hulu, Netflix, HBO Max</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Monthly price:  </strong></span><span>$8.99, $6.99, $14.99, $5.99</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answers: </em></strong><em>1. underemployed  2. greater than ($16.8 billion) 3. Cache 4. true 5. Disney+ = $6.99, Netflix (basic) = $8.99, Hulu (basic) = $5.99, HBO Max = $14.99</em></sup></p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You learn something new every day. </strong>Yesterday, we wrote that the highest altitude bank branch was in Peru. A reader named Pete informed us that we should’ve used the word <em>elevation </em>rather than <em>altitude</em>. As we found out, there’s a <a href="https://english.stackexchange.com/questions/107514/elevation-vs-altitude?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big difference</a>. Putting it simply...<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Altitude</strong></span><span> typically measures the height of an aircraft in flight.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Elevation </strong></span><span>measures the height relative to sea level of something fixed to the ground.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/google/223/shocked-face-with-exploding-head_1f92f.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""></p>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNzc1MTUzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAhead of the busy season for school parking lot donuts, Consumer Reports released the results of its closely watched automobile reliability survey. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe deets: \u003c/strong\u003eEvery year, the nonprofit magazine collects responses on its members' experiences with their cars. This year, it received reviews for over 420,000 vehicles. It then ranks 30 auto brands sold in the U.S. in terms of their \"reliability,\" which factors in potential \u003ca href=\"https://www.consumerreports.org/car-reliability-owner-satisfaction/consumer-reports-car-reliability-faq/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproblems\u003c/a\u003e in 17 trouble areas. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat we learned this year...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRule #1: If it ain't broke, don't turn it into the Batmobile \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eConsumer Reports found that newly redesigned models gave owners \u003ca href=\"https://www.consumerreports.org/car-reliability-owner-satisfaction/how-a-vehicle-redesign-can-drag-down-car-reliability/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore problems\u003c/a\u003e than vehicles bought close to the end of their production runs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA common complaint: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAutomakers have added gears to transmissions to meet fuel economy rules, but sometimes driving with 10 speeds is a little intense. Many readers reported rough, jerky transmissions in redesigned models, CR's director of auto testing \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/95cb2141a82045e59fe8dde06fa695ce?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the AP\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn all, 45% of new or redesigned vehicles have predicted reliability that's below average.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRule #2: Japanese cars are the most reliable \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLexus, Mazda, and Toyota were named the \u003ca href=\"https://www.consumerreports.org/car-reliability-owner-satisfaction/who-makes-the-most-reliable-cars/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost reliable car brands\u003c/a\u003e in that order (Lexus is Toyota's luxury brand). South Korea's Hyundai also had a strong showing; its Genesis, Hyundai, and Kia brands all made it into the top 10. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eU.S. and European automakers...get your shift together. GM's Cadillac brand came in \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-makes-some-improvements-in-consumer-reports-latest-reliability-ranks-11573753526?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edead last\u003c/a\u003e, while Ford's F-150 pickup—despite being the top-selling vehicle in the U.S.—has below-average reliability. Meanwhile, CR members consider VW's and Acura's SUVs to be \"problematic.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRule #3: Always close your auto stories on a high note \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter pulling it last year, Consumer Reports \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/14/consumer-reports-puts-tesla-back-on-recommended-list-as-reliability-improves.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erestored\u003c/a\u003e Tesla's Model 3 and Model S \"recommended\" rating. Turns out, when your CEO doesn't have to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2018-07-12/how-tesla-s-model-3-became-elon-musk-s-version-of-hell?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esleep under a desk\u003c/a\u003e at the factory to oversee production, you can make a more reliable car. As a brand, Tesla moved up four spots to #23. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLadies and gentlereaders, meet the largest newspaper publisher in the U.S. Yesterday, shareholders \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/11/14/gannett-finalizes-deal-become-nations-largest-newspaper-publisher-setting-stage-million-cuts/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e GateHouse parent New Media Investment Group's \u003cspan\u003e~$1.1\u003c/span\u003e billion acquisition of Gannett. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRun the numbers:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe combined company will publish \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/14/business/media/gannett-gatehouse-media-merger.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e260+ daily newspapers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and 300+ weeklies, including USA Today, The Detroit Free Press, and The Palm Beach Post. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePrint circulation is estimated to top 8 million, while web traffic is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2019/11/14/gannett-new-media-investment-group-merger-vote-results/2578352001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpected\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to average more than 145 million monthly unique visitors. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo stay out of the Newseum, Gannett (the new company's name) has said it will find up to $300 million in savings. That worries the U.S.' top newspaper union, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/11/08/gannett-merger-nears-completion-union-claims-deal-threatens-journalism/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarned\u003c/a\u003e that \"local papers will likely disappear, jobs will be slashed, and journalism will suffer\" because of the deal.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe U.S. has lost almost 1,800 papers since 2004, per \u003ca href=\"https://www.usnewsdeserts.com/reports/expanding-news-desert/loss-of-local-news/loss-newspapers-readers/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eUNC research\u003c/a\u003e. And the majority of those remaining have a circulation of less than 15,000. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe companies expect the deal to close next Tuesday, Nov. 19.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, presidential candidate Sen. Elizabeth Warren released an \u003ca href=\"https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.cnbc.com/amp/2019/11/13/elizabeth-warren-blasts-billionaires-in-campaign-ad-calling-for-wealth-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ead\u003c/a\u003e, \"Elizabeth Warren Stands Up to Billionaires.\" It alleges former Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein, investor Leon Cooperman, and VC Peter Thiel engaged in some shady dealings.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBlankfein \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/14/lloyd-blankfein-mocks-elizabeth-warren-maybe-tribalism-is-just-in-her-dna.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshot back\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Twitter, \"Maybe tribalism is just in her DNA,\" an apparent reference to Warren's previous claims of Native American ancestry. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWarren's been bare-knuckle boxing with billionaires for weeks. An aggressive \u003ca href=\"https://elizabethwarren.com/ultra-millionaire-tax/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewealth tax\u003c/a\u003e is key to funding her ultra-expensive plans like Medicare for All. But many on Wall St. are balking at the proposed 6% hit on assets above $1 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlankfein's co-stars also have thoughts: \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThiel: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"I'm most scared by Elizabeth Warren.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWarren's response:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/07/16/peter-thiel-vs-elizabeth-warren/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGood\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCooperman: \"\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis is the f—ing American dream she is s—ting on.\" Cooperman got teary on CNBC thinking about it. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWarren's response: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAdding \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://shop.elizabethwarren.com/products/billionaire-tears-mug?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea \"billionaire tears\" mug\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to her merch offerings. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ea recent \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/14/business/warren-wealth-tax-economy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanalysis\u003c/a\u003e from the \u003cspan\u003ePenn Wharton Budget Model \u003c/span\u003eestimated Warren's plan would depress economic growth about 0.2% over a decade. \u003cspan\u003eBut economists in Warren's corner say that doesn't account for the indirect jumpstart the economy would get from style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, the world’s largest Starbucks \u003ca href=\"https://chicago.eater.com/2019/11/13/20961830/chicago-starbucks-reserve-roastery-photos-images-worlds-largest?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopens\u003c/a\u003e in Chicago. The 35,000 square-feet of awkward networking space will join seven other Starbucks stores already located on the Magnificent Mile. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThis one, of course, is different. It’s the company's sixth “Reserve Roastery,” \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/12/take-a-look-inside-starbucks-newest-reserve-roastery-in-chicago.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emega-locations\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e handcrafted to match each city’s vibe. Roasteries can serve over 8,000 visitors per day on average. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe know what you’re thinking: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003eHow many beans does one city need? \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAsk the Roastery's architects, who were clearly ripping triple-shots during the design process. A 56-foot cask (or bean container) \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90427426/inside-the-new-largest-starbucks-on-the-planet?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eforms the spine\u003c/a\u003e, supporting a hamster cage-esque system of tubes that uses air pressure to zoom beans throughout the store. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAcross the five floors you'll find three coffee bars, a bakery, a roof terrace, and a cocktail bar (heck yeah they serve Malört).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe other roasteries are located in NYC, Tokyo, Shanghai, Milan, and Seattle. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F14%2Fworlds-biggest-starbucks-opens-chicago\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eIt’s Day 4 of our teardown of the streaming industry to mark the launch of Disney+. If you missed them, here are \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003epart 1\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e,\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/4-minute-history-disney?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003epart 2\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, \u003cem\u003eand \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/streaming-subscription-costs-dollarsheres?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epart 3\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow that you have hundreds of hours of \u003cem\u003eThe Simpsons \u003c/em\u003eat your fingertips, it's no sweat to cut the cord...right? Turns out, there's one thing traditional TV customers still cling to: live sports. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNetworks like CBS, Fox, and ESPN have together paid billions for the exclusive rights to air U.S. professional sports games. But starting in 2021, bidding rights for the big leagues start to reopen. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWe hear Big Tech has a big wallet \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBezos, forget buying an NFL team...what about buying the streaming rights? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith expansive media platforms already spun up, tech companies could bring professional sports to a streaming-first model without starting from scratch. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey could layer on features like in-game polls to create personalized, interactive experiences. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome leagues and tournaments have tested live streams that allow viewers to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://frntofficesport.com/twitter-nba-tnt/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efollow\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a single player or watch in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ncaa.com/news/basketball-men/article/2019-04-08/how-watch-2019-ncaa-march-madness-games-virtual-reality?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evirtual reality\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe catch: \u003c/strong\u003eLeagues have been hesitant to give exclusive live rights to tech companies, Quartz \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1418594/the-future-of-how-we-watch-sports-is-in-limbo-until-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e.
